title: Build Mobile Websites and Apps for Smart Devices
author: Earle Castledine, Myles Eftos, Max Wheeler
summary: This book guides developers through building mobile-optimized websites and hybrid apps for smart devices using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript. It covers mobile UX best practices, device APIs, responsive layouts, and cross-platform techniques, including PhoneGap (now Apache Cordova). Aimed at web developers making the leap into mobile, it balances conceptual learning with hands-on examples.
notes: Released at a pivotal time when mobile-first was emerging as a serious web standard. Part of SitePointâ€™s practical, developer-friendly series.

title: Mobile Marketing: Finding Your Customers No Matter Where They Are
author: Cindy Krum
summary: This book provides a comprehensive overview of mobile marketing strategies, helping businesses connect with customers through mobile websites, apps, messaging, and location-aware services. Cindy Krum explains how to integrate mobile into existing digital marketing efforts and optimize content for a wide range of mobile devices and behaviors. It's an accessible resource for marketers adapting to a mobile-first world.
notes: Although written in 2010, many strategic frameworks still apply. Covers both technical and business considerations during the rise of smartphones.
